channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [DERBY-5379] testDERBY5120NumRowsInSydependsForTrigger - The number of values assigned is not the same as the number of specified or implied columns.
item.description:
Cf. nightly here: http://dbtg.foundry.sun.com/derby/test/Daily/jvm1.5/testing/testlog/vista/1154999-derbyall_diff.txt

item.summary: testDERBY5120NumRowsInSydependsForTrigger - The number of values assigned is not the same as the number of specified or implied columns.

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: I have a zip file ("nanna31.zip") of ca 80Mb of the db files from this test including the contents of the fail directory, please request it if you want to look at this issue.

Hi
I did a search for testDERBY5120NumRowsInSydependsForTrigger in trunk and its subfolders but couldnt locate it. Is this in a different location

Sorry. I did find it in functionTests.tests.upgradeTest.BasicSetup
public void testDERBY5120NumRowsInSydependsForTrigger() throws Exception

Hi Dag,
I am trying to replicate this issue by trying to do java -Dderby.tests.trace=true junit.textui.TestRunner org.apache.derbyTesting.functionTests.tests.upgradeTests._Suite > runoutputAug30.out 2>&1.

But the tests are running ok so far.... Is there any particular version or particular phase of upgrade this test fails?

Jayaram, I only saw this once in the regression tests. I can send you the zip file I saved away from that run, maybe you can glean something from it. It's a bit large (80Mb), so I'm not sure which is the best way for get that to you. Mail is probably difficult... Are you on any IM that can send/receive files? If so, send me your nick and we can agree to exchange the file.
Thanks Dag. I am not aware of any IM with 80 mb attachment facility.. One option is we can try file splitting an upload in 8 individual chunks if possible

I just started running tests on a new machine with Windows 7 64bit i7 CPU and saw this failure in 2/2 runs of suites.All followed by various failures that I think just cascade because of this one. Let me know if there is any there is any debugging code you would like me to add for my next run,

FAILURES!!!
Tests run: 14497, Failures: 2, Errors: 7
I neglected to mention. I saw this on trunk 10.9.0.0 alpha - (1198002) with clean trunk and 10.9.0.0 alpha - (1200994M) with a few local unrelated changes.
I am looking at this to see what the cause might be.

After debugging this a little, I believe it is a test issue and not Derby engine code issue. I am able to reproduce it consistently on my trunk client with ibm jdk 1.6. I think I should have a fix for the errors I see by tomorrow evening.

Myrna, I am not sure why it is not showing consistently on your runs. One reason could be that the newest 10.8 release jars are not one of the candidate jars being used for upgrade tests but then it won't explain why it shows at other times on your runs. Let's see what my proposed fix handles the errors and how it works on your upgrade test runs. I plan on fixing this hopefully by tomorrow.
Thanks Mamta. I am looking forward to hearing what it is. I was wondering do you also see the other errors I reported in my 11/11/11 comment? Do they cascade from the test error you found?

Hi Kathey, yes, I see all the errors you saw except test_notBooted(org.apache.derbyTesting.functionTests.tests.jdbc4.Driver40UnbootedTest)junit.frame
Error: expected:<0> but was:<1>
I am running only the upgrade tests(not the whole junite suite) and probably test_notBooted is not even one of the tests that got run as part of upgrade suite. I am not sure about the cause of test_notBooted

I have checked in a fix for these test failures into trunk. The commit comments were as follows
********
DERBY-5379 testDERBY5120NumRowsInSydependsForTrigger - The number of values assigned is not the same as the number of specified or implied columns.
DERBY-5484 Upgradetest fails with upgrade from 10.8.2.2 (7 errors, 1 failure) on trunk

The above 2 jiras are duplicates. The upgrade tests are failing when doing an upgrade from 10.8.2.2 to trunk.

The tests that are failing were written for DERBY-5120, DERBY-5044. Both these bugs got fixed in 10.8.2.2 and higher.

The purpose of these tests is to show that when the tests are done with a release with those fixes missing, we will see the incorrect behavior but once the database is upgraded to 10.8.2.2 and higher, the tests will start functioning correctly. The problem is that we do not recognize that if the database is created with 10.8.2.2, then we will not the problem behavior because 10.8.2.2 already has the required fixes in it for DERBY-5120 and DERBY-5044. I have fixed this by making the upgrade test understand that incorrect behavior would be seen only for releases under 10.8.2.2
********

This can be backported to 10.8 codeline. Without the backport, if we ever want to test the upgrade from 10.8.2.2 to the next point release of 10.8/top of the 10.8 codeline, then I think we will see the same failures there as well.
Mamta can this be resolved as fixed?
